ABSTRACT

06 August 2013
Proposal Number: 1322053
Institution: University of Miami
PI: R. Findley

This proposal requests four Shipboard Scientific Support Equipment (SSSE) items for the R/V WALTON SMITH which is operated by the University of Miami; namely a new trawl block, water weights, a computerized maintenance system, and a bow thruster evaluation study. These items will either improve safety or enhance the vessel?s science support capabilities.

Broader Impacts: The R/V WALTON SMITH supports federally funded scientific research in the southern Atlantic Ocean and the Gulf of Mexico in order to expand human knowledge of the ocean environment. During operations, the vessel routinely exposes graduate and undergraduate students to seagoing oceanography. Pubic outreach is also achieved through real-time satellite connectivity from ship to shore, open house events, and educational cruises. The WALTON SMITH is scheduled to complete approximately 120 NSF sponsored days in 2013.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The University of Miami’s 2013 Shipboard Scientific Support Equipment award consisted of the following items to be purchased or a contract awarded for (value of each in parenthesis):

  1. Purchase of Capstans for Scientific Equipment Retrieval - ($19,800)
  2. Purchase of Trawl Block for Use with 3/8" Wire Rope - ($14,150)
  3. Contract for Bow Thruster Upgrade Feasibility Study - ($14,616)
  4. Purchase of Computerized Maintenance System - ($18,774)
  5. Purchase of Water Weight for Load Testing - ($7,425)

Total Value of Award - $74,765

As of 1 February 2016 the status of each item noted above is:

1.  Purchase of Capstans for Scientific Equipment Retrieval - New capstans were not purchased.  Instead funds were used to rebuild an air powered capstan the University of Miami owned.

2. Purchase of Trawl Block for Use with 3/8" Wire Rope - New trawl blocks were purchased and installed on the A-frame of the Walton Smith (as seen in attached picture).

3.  Contract for Bow Thruster Upgrade Feasibility Study - study was completed.  Actions, as a result of that study, on are hold as another study was recently initiated to evaluate more than just the bow thrusters.  Funding for the additional study was received via the University of Miami’s 2015 SSSE award.

4. Purchase of Computerized Maintenance System - The University of Miami purchased Wheelhouse Marine Maintenance System for use aboard the F.G. Walton Smith.  The system is aboard the vessel, was populated by Wheelhouse with funds from the award, and now the system is being used by the crew.

5. Purchase of Water Weight for Load Testing - A water weight bag was purchased and is now used for all weight testing aboard the F.G. Walton Smith (see attached picture).

The crew of the F. G. Walton Smith and Marine Operations thanks NSF for the award.  All items from the award have led to more efficient, effective and safe scientific operations aboard.
